summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from October 2020 discussing technical issues with accessing media files (audio/video) related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The files include grand jury testimony from 2006, a 2007 FBI interview, and a 2010 deposition of Epstein. The correspondence is between FBI Litigation Support personnel and an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York, coordinating on discovery materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of a 2010 deposition video file that is part of the media collection being discussed. He is the central figure in the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: Audio files of grand jury testimony were recorded. The media was received from the Palm Beach State Attorney's Office.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: An interview was conducted by FBI Special Agents. The media was received from ICE.

events.title: Deposition of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A video deposition of Jeffrey Epstein was taken. The media was received from an attorney.

keyFacts: The FBI's Litigation Support Unit was handling media files from Epstein case file number 31E-MM-108062 in October 2020.
Technical issues (a 'codec problem') prevented listening to 48 audio files of grand jury testimony from July 19, 2006, suggesting a possible error when the AUSA's office exported the media.
The media collection included a 2007 FBI interview and a 2010 video deposition of Jeffrey Epstein, indicating the longevity and scope of the investigative materials.
The email chain shows coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding discovery materials for the Epstein case.
The correspondence references the transfer of thousands of pages of scanned records (16,000 to 29,000 pages) in early 2019, highlighting the volume of evidence involved.
